comments.body: Yeah! That‚Äôs definitely a cool idea and I like it! Let‚Äôs reuse channeling.

Making a spectrum of items to put in the portal I genius! I was also thinking we could add a feature that all the ender eye slots in the portal are closed off, rendering it impossible to go in unless you use an expensive and rare item to awaken and fight a powerful boss mob pertaining the the stronghold theme that is guarding the portal. Thus would add at least another half minute to the gameplay. You know what? This boss should be a statue called the strongholder. It summons silver fish at its feet as it pummels you with strong fists, and you awaken it with a heavy core. Once you kill the strongholder, the hea y core drops back to you intact, and th ender eye slots are opened to go fight the dragon.

The only difference (appearance-wise) a tamed wolf should have from an untamed one is the fact that tamed dogs have a collar, (and possibly armor, if you put it on) and untamed ones don't.
Amazing idea!
Also add an armor trim for the trial chambers
And Horse Armor!
Each structure could have their own type of key you can get from there, so they're all not reliant on the Trial Chambers.
I love the Idea of the ancient city getting a vault block. It wouldn't just guarantee Players to get the Loot but would also really fit the look of the Warden's home.

I would love to see trial vaults in Woodland Mansions, End Ships, Ocean Monuments and Bastions. Mansions, End Ships and Bastions contain items like the netherite upgrade template, elytra and totem of undying which are heavily sought after, and totems are way easier to get through raids. I think it would be great if mobs like Evokers or Piglin Brutes dropped vault keys for their structures which could be used to get Totems and Upgrade Templates. Plus, you could add a new mob to the end that would drop the key to teh end ship vault. Fianlly, I think it would be cool to have a vault in Ocean Monuments opened with keys from Elder Gaurdians because it woudl help give players more of a reason to explore them beyond just getting all the prismarine blocks.

This also goes really well with the Slight-Slowed Copper Bulb. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/22998359363597-Slight-Slowed-Copper-Bulb

Here are the copper bulb delays for the Slight-Slowed Copper Bulb:

  • 1gt: Normal
  • 2gt: Exposed
  • 3gt: Weathered
  • 4gt: Oxidized

If the copper bulb is not waxed:

  • 1gt: Normal
  • 2gt: Exposed
  • 4gt: Weathered
  • 6gt: Oxidized

Maybe instead of them being able to be crafted, you could find them as loot in structures.
Being dropped by bosses for specific totems is a good idea. Though instead of crafting it you find a plain totem in structures. Then using this plain totem you put it on an anvil and combine it with an item to specify what type of totem it is.
Also in order for a totem to be used it should require some experience points.

Instead of finding ones with abilities already active you could kill an evoker to get a "Totem Base" then combine it with gemstones to get special abilities that go active whenever you complete an action like Leveling up, spreading skulk, dying, or getting a negative potion effect.

Leveling up effects can give you items or positive potion effects upon use.

Spreading Skulk can make it so you can't set of shiekers for a set amount of time.

Dying will just be the totem of undying.

Receiving a negative potion effect can give you the opposing effect or just cure it.

I think the 30min cooldown, insanely long mining time, and limited spawn amounts are hard enough nerfs that this idea could become a reality. Using the copper key as a consumable to unlock the ability to move a single trial spawner per use could bring insane amounts of new ideas to the community!
Back in Alpha and Infdev, monster spawners were movable with a pickaxe. However, it only spawns pigs on placement.

and even if they don't fight, they should still get armor because that way we can take our cats on adventures with us, and the fact that when dogs get armor and cats don't, it is very unfair.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/21347613191181-More-animal-armor

I haven't liked Minecraft cats ever since they ruined the ocelot. The ocelot used to be fun, and still is in Legacy Edition, because it was the only way to get a cat. Now, ocelots are worthless, and I barely care about cats.

This is also similar to the copper-hopper mod, and my suggestion of adding filter-hoppers.  They should be able to handle non-stackable or items that stack less than 64.  The copper-hopper and golder-hopper mods are examples, and also indicate just how useful this feature would be.  It fit in well with the other 1.21 updates like the auto-crafter.  Current redstone solutions are large, unreliable and don't handle items that don't stack.

The copper-hopper mod is also a perfect example of how this should work.  This would be a great addition to the autocrafter and 1.21.  I'm not affiliated with copper-hopper in any way, just a fan of the idea and the copper-hopper's implementation of it.  The ability to filter by multiple items, regardless of stackability, allows trickle-down filtering as well as multiple items sorted together in a single chest or output.  It takes more than a room full of redstone to achieve anything remotely similar, and is unreliable at best.  This would help bring better automation to the masses.
It could even be a hopper with a UI button to lock the items so only their amounts can change, and additional empty slots are blocked.
and if they're powered / locked, using the new trial key would fit PERFECTLY :D
Maybe a special copper key could be used.

Yes, this seems much simpler! I feel like it would be really annoying to have to send a timed redstone pulse every time you want an item to be released into the crafter. Blueprints definitely the way to go!

The mobs that spawn in trial chambers are randomized, so there would be no way to ensure the breeze would spawn. However, some trial chamber rooms are already made for specific mobs to have an advantage, and part of the fun is seeing how mobs that weren't intended for the environment do there.
Technically with structure blocks this is possible. Since breeze spawners are in there own pool. They are random, except for breezes.

This is all around a really bad idea and I'm going to copy most of this comment from the comment I left on the other proposed feedback about the same thing. It may make modifying the game slightly more difficult, but it's by no means impossible. This is actually a quirk of the Java language. Basically, most languages will compile your code into something a machine can read and execute. Java however, compiles your code into byte-code which is close to, but not quite machine readable code. When you run a Java application, Java actually compiles this byte-code down to machine code at runtime. This has the benefit that you can run Java apps on any machine that can run Java instead of needing a different compilation for each piece of hardware. If it works on Windows, it'll work on Mac or Linux with no extra steps. This is like the big selling point of Java. Native-Image would only do so much to combat this. It is not a perfect solution at all, and would create more work for the developers as they'd need to compile a different version of Minecraft for each operating system. DRM is a bad suggestion in any circumstance too. Ironically, this would make the situation worse because mod developers would be overburdened with no incentive to keep working, while cheat developers would continue to have a very clear financial incentive. Please, reconsider your feedback.
Hmmm, animals are typically bred with the same food you use to tame them. The only exception that I'm aware of is the wolf. The monkeys should also be bred with regular coconuts, not golden ones.
Another exception are horses. They are either bred with golden apples or golden carrots.

They should only be able to carry one item at a time. Allays already carry stacks of items and were added solely for that purpose. Fetching could just be a detail added onto the wolves that doesn't really help the player, but look more real and endearing.
